column2: also known as the Turkish Empire
column5: was an empire founded in 1299 by Oghuz Turks under Osman I in northwestern Anatolia. After conquests in the Balkans by Murad I between 1362 and 1389
column6: the Ottoman sultanate was transformed into a transcontinental empire and claimant to the caliphate. The Ottomans ended the Byzantine Empire with the 1453 conquest of Constantinople by Mehmed the Conqueror. During the 16th and 17th centuries
column7: at the height of its power under the reign of Suleiman the Magnificent
column8: the Ottoman Empire was a multinational
column9: multilingual empire controlling much of Southeast Europe
column13: and the Horn of Africa. At the beginning of the 17th century the empire contained 32 provinces and numerous vassal states. Some of these were later absorbed into the Ottoman Empire
column14: while others were granted various types of autonomy during the course of centuries.
